Module kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem
Package kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.controller.parts

Class PartsController

java.lang.Object
kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.controller.parts.PartsController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddPartController, ModifyPartController
public abstract class PartsController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Abstract controller class for the Parts FXML view.
Author:
Timothy Albert Kline

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes select member variables and modifies form "title" label. Calls helper functions to initialize containers for various FXML fields. Injects formLabelTitle into partFormLBL.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - url
      resourceBundle - resource bundle

    • handleSaveBtnEvent

      public abstract void handleSaveBtnEvent(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      Handles save event. Must call validateInput() to parse and check user inputs from FXML form.
      Parameters:
      event - button click. Used for redirecting to a new scene after saving.
      Throws:
      Exception - error log.
      See Also:
      • validateInputs()

    • fetchSelectedSrc

      protected void fetchSelectedSrc()
      Determines the current Part's source type by checking which radio button is selected.

    • validateInputs

      protected void validateInputs() throws IllegalArgumentException
      Passes each input from the user through a series of checks. Calls fetchSelectedSrc to add appropriate source information to the current set of editable text field containers. Iterates through editableTextFields to pass each item into the global validator checker, ErrorHandler. If user input is invalid, a flag is triggered and the checking continues. Afterwards, if any checks are flagged, method throws. Corresponding feedback for each text field is updated by ErrorHandler during the checks.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if inputs flagged as invalid
      See Also:
      • ErrorHandler
